Dear @tfnub: this issue is probably not the best place for this kind of questions, I guess it would be better to use stackoverflow for that. (Otherwise everyone subscribed to this issue will be spammed by this conversation.)

Re the masking: if you have a special value for the missing elements (like 0), you can get get the mask by using tf.not_equal(targets, SPECIAL_MISSING_VALUE). Afterwards you can either use tf.boolean_mask or multiply the loss tensor by the float-casted mask elementwise. If you want the mean batch loss, you can divide the loss sum by tf.maximum(1, number_valid_elements) to avoid getting nans.

Dear @tfnub: this issue is probably not the best place for this kind of questions, I guess it would be better to use stackoverflow for that. (Otherwise everyone subscribed to this issue will be spammed by this conversation.)

Re the masking: if you have a special value for the missing elements (like 0), you can get get the mask by using `tf.not_equal(targets, SPECIAL_MISSING_VALUE)`. Afterwards you can either use `tf.boolean_mask` or multiply the loss tensor by the float-casted mask elementwise. If you want the mean batch loss, you can divide the loss sum by `tf.maximum(1, number_valid_elements)` to avoid getting nans.
